name: AWS
usage: Amazon Web Services (AWS) hosts our website.

name: Babel
usage: Babel converts our JSX into browser compatible JS.

name: Docker
usage: Docker runs the development and production HTTP servers.

name: Flask
usage: Flask supports our backend web framework, which is written in Python.

name: GitBook
usage: All material regarding the development of our website is extensively documented with GitBook.

name: GitHub
usage: GitHub hosts the GameFrame source repository.

name: JavaScript
usage: Most of the front-end is written in JavaScript.

name: NameCheap
usage: Namecheap allowed us this cool domain name, gameframe.online.

name: npm
usage: npm is our JS node package manager.

name: Postman
usage: We use Postman to document, develop, and test our API.

name: Python
usage: Most of the backend is written in Python.

name: React-Bootstrap
usage: React-Bootstrap is a resource library for ReactJS that allowed us to mock up this website with features like the carousel and navbar.

name: ReactJS
usage: ReactJS supports our front-end web-framework, which is written in JavaScript.

name: React Router
usage: React Router is a resource library for ReactJS that allowed us to seamlessly load pages within our website.

name: React-Twitter-Embed
usage: React-Twitter-Embed is a resource library for Twitter plug-ins.

name: Slack
usage: Slack is where we communicate with each other.

name: SmartDraw
usage: SmartDraw is a tool we used to create a UML diagram.

name: Webpack
usage: Webpack manages our JS files into one package.

name: Chai
usage: Chai makes assertions easier when testing our JavaScript code with Mocha.

name: Enzyme
usage: Enzyme makes testing our JavaScript code with Mocha easier.

name: Eslint
usage: Eslint helps maintain our JavaScript code in a specific error-free format.

name: iso-3166-1
usage: Country codes within website are parsed by iso-3166-1.

name: Mocha
usage: Mocha tests our JavaScript code.

name: MySQL
usage: MySQL manages our database.

name: Radium
usage: Radium manages our inline styles and states on React elements.

name: React-Redux
usage: React-Redux manages our state of data throughout the website.

name: Selenium
usage: Selenium tests our graphical user interface.

name: Sinon
usage: Sinon helps mock up data for testing our JavaScript code with Mocha.

name: SQLAlchemy
usage: SQLAlchemy is our Python SQL toolkit and Object Relational Mapper.

name: react-highlight-words
usage: React-hihglight-words allows us to highlight the searched terms in the results of the search page.
